original_title: Sri Lanka inks deal to send workers to Israel
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka has signed an agreement to send workers to Israel, Cabinet spokesman and Transport Minister Bandula Gunwardana said.
“Sri Lankan workers would be temporarily employed under a specific section of Israel’s labor market,” cabinet spokesperson, minister Bandula Gunawardena said at Tuesday’s press briefing.
Israel and Gaza Strip is now involved in a military conflict.
Workers sent from Sri Lanka to Israel will be guaranteed security (is-tha-ram ah-rak-sha-vak), Gunawardena said.

Concerns have emerged about the safety of Sri Lankas in the area the death of a Sri Lankan worker. Several Sri Lankans who were in Gaza at the time of war started has also been evacuated. (Colombo/Nov21/2023)
